selection.desc: N fingers of the left hand = N words (index + middle = 2 words)
Index + thumb, start with a pinch then part them to start selection
Use both indices, start with slightly close position, then separate them away to start selecting
Raise hand with 5 fingers, then move the index to select, then rotate the hand to show a window to insert replacement
Double tap with the right index to start selecting, then move and slide the index to select
Double tap with the right index, then move to select, then tap to end selection
Start with a pinch to indicate the start of selection, then part the index and thumb away and move to select, then pinch to indicate the end to selection

gestures.desc: Move whole hand(s) while in selection position
Move the right index to move selected text
After placing the cursor on the word, move index down (cut), then index up (paste) in target position
Grab selected text, then move to target position and release it by relaxing the hand

Comments.text: It is easy to interpertate, easy to use

He suggested using both hands for selection of longer phrases, so that you can expand more than just using your thumb and index. Suggested a dropdown menu after selecting a word to select a replacement word. He also prefer one hand to do the gesture
I will use both indices, and then select the way is used before, it is easier
When we combine all gestures, it will make sence, make it consistent, and less operatios
We don't have a drage option with keyboard, so I guess it is better
It is more human like, just grap it and move it
It is logically connected to the first gesture I proposed. I use the index and thumb to select a word or group words
